title: PRD ReDesign: BMI Calculator For Weight Loss Category
background: The BMI Calculator is designed to serve as an interactive and SEO-friendly element on the Weight Loss category page. It provides users with a fast, private, and informative way to assess whether their weight falls within a healthy range.
goal: Both educate and convert: For users, it provides clarity and trust. For DoktorABC, it strengthens engagement and drives conversions toward consultations and paid orders.
widget_formats: Popup message opening from the bottom when user clicks 'Calculate my BMI'
Static section embedded within the Weight Loss category drilldown

characteristics: Often struggling with overweight or obesity, concerned about appearance and health
Unsure if they need medication or whether it's safe for them
Seek private, quick validation - 'Where do I stand?'
Motivation: clarity, safety, cost, and eligibility for treatment
users.mindset: I'm worried about my weight but not sure what to do next. I want a simple, trustworthy way to check if I need help, without talking to anyone yet.

success_metrics: Improved SEO performance and ranking in the 'Weight Loss' category
Conversion rate from users who used the calculator → paid orders (tracked across full funnel)
Higher engagement (CTR on 'Calculate my BMI' and 'Start Consultation' CTAs)

development_requirements.description: Widget appears in the Weight Loss category drilldown section on the homepage
Button labeled 'Calculate my BMI' triggers popup from the bottom up

Title: 'BMI Calculator', Subtitle: 'BMI stands for Body Mass Index. It's a simple calculation that uses your height and weight to estimate whether your weight is within a healthy range for your body.'
Two input fields: Height (cm) and Weight (kg). Both required, positive numbers. Error state: red outline and small error text below field.
validation_rules: Error state: red outline and small error text below field

development_requirements.description: Button labeled 'Calculate' validates inputs, calculates BMI using formula: BMI = weight (kg) / (height (m)²), scrolls popup to show results section
Below Calculate button display 'Start Consultation' button leading to Weight Loss consultation funnel
Circular BMI 'clock' dial with 4 ranges. Center text shows BMI number. Default before calculation: BMI = 0 and all ranges neutral.
Below the dial display the static legend with all ranges. The legend value corresponding to the user's BMI must be highlighted.

If user's BMI falls into Overweight or Obesity, show recommendation card with: Image: Ozempic + Weight Loss product, Message: 'Find out if our weight loss treatments are right for you.', CTA button: 'Start Consultation'
Under calculator results, display SEO-optimized BMI educational content from Google Doc
formatting: Use subheadings (e.g., 'What is BMI?', 'How to calculate BMI')
Use bulleted or numbered lists where appropriate
Light background, soft padding, consistent spacing
Accordion behavior: each section can expand/collapse

development_requirements.mobile: Popup is a full-height bottom sheet with drag-to-close + X button
development_requirements.tablet_desktop: Popup displayed as centered modal with rounded corners

development_requirements.description: User can close via: X icon in top-right corner, Swipe down (mobile), Click outside the modal (desktop)
